revised_title: Enhancing Robinson's Conjecture and Packing of 23 Circles on a Sphere
tldr: The authors investigate the problem of determining the largest angular diameter of equal circles that can be packed on a sphere without overlapping. They focus on Robinson's conjecture and provide a new packing construction for 23 circles on a sphere with a circle diameter of 43.709964°. The authors also discuss the arrangement for 29 circles with a circle diameter of 38.6771°.
